RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RED PRIESTESS took the lead at the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. ALL WORKED UP gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and dug in through the lane to hold second. FLAT OUT COOL chased, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. SUPERSNAKE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LECTRIC ROD broke awkwardly and gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened stride. LADY WHISTLEDOWN gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane. MYGIDGETMARIE chased toward the inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little more. ULTIMATE BREEZE gave chase to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Red Priestess
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,steady handling lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE SEPTEMBER 30, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since September 30 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOLLER broke awkwardly but took a quick lead and set a pressured pace while tapering to the inside, raced at the rail on the turn and just lasted under steady stretch handling. MOSS BOSS chased the pace inside, rounded the turn near the rail, dueled for a clear second inside the sixteenth pole and finished well while gaining on the winner. STEVETHEVANDRIVER pressured the pace, raced close off the rail into the turn but drifted leaving the turn and flattened the final sixteenth. SCARLET TANAGER chased the pace, rounded the turn in the three path and ran evenly in the lane. GOT FLOFFY gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. TIZ DEJA BLUE gave chase but faded in the five path of the turn. ALWAYS DRINKING chased outside, raced in the six path on the turn then weakened. BIG HAMBONE stumbled to his nose and lost his rider leaving the gate. The Stewards reviewed and dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Toller, for alleged interference in the vicinity of the three eighths pole, lodged by the rider of Stevethevandriver.

ENTRY.NAME: Toller
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,set pressured pace,rail turn,just lasted driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligib ility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHENANDOAH CAT cleared rivals on the chute and angled to the inside to rate the pace, was moderately pressured into the turn then drew off while in hand through the lane. MY PRETTY EYES chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and had to settle for second. SISTER JOANN exchanged contact with Church Key leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three and four paths and dueled through the stretch for third. YESSIROFFICER came away awkwardly, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, eased out leaving the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. MOJO MATTERS chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and ran evenly in the lane. CHURCH KEY exchanged contact with Sister Joann leaving the gate, picked up the chase down the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four and five paths and showed little in the lane. UPTOWN BELLE chased inside and never factored. RISKSRHIGHPAYISLOW gave chase, though never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Uptown Belle
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Rayan and Knoblauch Michelle R

ENTRY.NAME: Shenandoah Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: cleared chute,rated pace inside,pressured 1/4,in hand lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 93. Starter Allowance Purse 23000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE MARCH 30, 2021. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 30 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where En tered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DULCIMER DAME rated close in the four path on the opening turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, took the lead three wide midway on the far turn, dueled clear inside the eighth pole and held on well under steady handling. DAT DARES GOLD rounded the first turn in the three path, bid leaving the three eighths pole and raced two deep on the far turn, came between horses at the eighth pole and dueled through the stretch for second. TEQUILA FOG saved ground off the pace, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. SECRET CASTLE raced with the pace two deep, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole and took the nod two deep approaching the five sixteenths pole, was met between horses midway on the far turn then flattened in the lane. UNLOCK raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and flattened in the lane. TIZ MICHELLE'S WAY was hustled along to show the way early then rated into the first turn, came under pressure toward the seven sixteenths pole, was met toward the five sixteenths pole, continued close at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. SHERIFF'S KID showed little response through the backstretch. CLASSIC COLORS saved ground on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths and weakened. TEMPORARILY rounded the first turn in the three and four paths and never factored.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 43. Maiden Claiming Purse 13300. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAKE CHARGE LISA pressured the pace inside, took the lead at the rail midway on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. FESSIN UP was bumped leaving the gate and gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and dueled clear in second mid-stretch. GREAT DEVOTION set a pressured pace leaving the half mile pole, was met two deep midway on the turn and relented second mid-stretch. GOT MORE chased the pace, rounded the turn in the four and five paths then flattened in the lane. RED LIL SHIPMENT broke inward and made contact with Fessin Up and took a brief early lead, gave chase past the half mile pole, rounded the turn about the four path then moved to the inside leaving the turn and showed little further. FIDDLERSHOTPLEASUR stumbled at the break and raced well back, rounded the turn in the three and four paths, eased out into the lane and passed rivals. PIPERINTHEPULPIT became anxious in the gate then steadied at the start, picked up the chase through the backstretch, angled out toward the head of the lane and showed little in the lane. PUERTORICAN DIVA was not a factor. CATAFFAIRWITHMEDAL steadied at the start and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Take Charge Lisa
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,up rail mid turn,steady handling lane

ENTRY.NAME: Puertorican Diva
ENTRY.OWNER: Iyacyas Racing LLC and Delgado William

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 30 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL LUCERITO took over toward the seven sixteenths pole and set a clear pace, raced at the rail through the turn and was taken in hand the final sixteenth. BERTRAM FLIGHT chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in through the lane to hold second. MISSIONARY gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, was brushed into the lane and finished well. CHIPPEWA'S CASTLE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. IN HIGH GEAR steadied at the start, gave chase through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. STROLLINGINTHEWIND chased the leaders, rounded the turn in the five path, left the turn outside and passed rivals. DONNIE B was shuffled back at the start and never factored. TALKING TEDDY chased, rounded the turn in the four path and weakened in the lane. CATS DIAMOND BOY hit the gate at the break, picked up the chase through the backstretch and raced two deep on the turn, drifted and made light contact with Missionary at the head of the lane, then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Bertram Flight
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,dug in lane,held on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Chippewa's Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear pace inside,rail turn,in hand final 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GATTO BE PROUD rated a slim lead inside, came under pressured leaving the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and held on well under steady handling. TREASURER ducked in and made contact with O'Rigsby leaving the gate then stalked off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. LOVETHEBAND stalked two deep, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and leveled off down the lane. O'RIGSBY was bumped soundly leaving the gate and saved ground well off the early pace, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, eased out leaving the eighth pole and ran evenly in the lane. ROCKIN CHAIR raced in the four path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then flattened in the lane. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE settled in the three path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. TURTLE DOVE stalked from the five path the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and weakened in the lane. COURT TUDOR showed little response through the backstretch. ONE CANDY CASTLE saved early ground, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. TOTHETRAINSTATION was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Gatto Be Proud
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 5/16,rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Lovetheband
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,leveled off lane

ENTRY.NAME: Kaylee's Spitfire
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Turtle Dove
ENTRY.OWNER: CM Racing and Jones Jr Michael E

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 24200. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE MARCH 30, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COMPANY CLOWN gave close chase through the backstretch, stayed in range of the lead three wide on the turn, dug in for the lead later yards and raced clear under the wire. BLACK CANDY pressured the pace and took the nod approaching the quarter pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught in later yards and just lasted for second. KUKULKAN rated just off the early pace, bid nearing the quarter pole and rounded the turn near the rail, finished well and just missed second. NITRO TIME came away awkwardly and set a pressured early pace outside, was met nearing the quarter pole, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn then flattened in later yards. FATHER WALSH chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and flattened in the lane. FREEDOM IS RINGING chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. BUTTONED UP was jostled at the break, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole and rounded the turn about the four path, lost some ground leaving the turn and showed little in the lane. BIG DADDY D R exchanged contact with Buttoned Up leaving the gate, raced well back outside and never factored. MI GUSTO ES exchanged contact with Buttoned Up leaving the gate, raced off the pace outside, rounded the turn about the four path and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Black Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,nod near 1/4,edge rail turn,caught late,lasted 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Kukulkan
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace,bid near 1/4,rail turn,finished well,just miss 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Nitro Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,early pace outside,met near 1/4,2d turn,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JALEBI BABY took over immediately and rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert through the lane. ROSELEE saved ground off the pace on the first turn, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, improved in the four path on the far turn and settled for second best. AWESOME INCENTIVE saved ground into the opening turn and raced well back leaving the turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and came along for third later yards. DECISIVE CAUSE settled off the rail on the first turn and rated close into the backstretch, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened in the lane. RAVIOLI MAMA saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened in the stretch. CODAS HONOR raced well back in the four path on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the seven path and passed rivals in the lane. I B NASTY rounded the first turn about the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. GOSSIPING raced in the four path the first turn then faded past the three eighths pole. SWEET SPIN showed little response. CAPTIVATING GAL closed toward contention and stalked the early pace, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail past the five sixteenths.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Adrian Regan, Fergus Galvin,Tony Hegarty & John Wade

ENTRY.NAME: Decisive Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,rated close 1/2,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Incentive
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid near 3/8,off rail far turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Codas Honor
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Ultra Championship Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back 4p,chased past 7/16,7p far turn,outside 1/8,pass rivals
